intro: Oxyceros rugulosus, commonly known as the rough-hair grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, rough-hairy leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Oxyceros rugulosus is often found in coastal and inland regions, contributing to local biodiversity.
